    n, k = list(map(int, input().split(' ')))
    elems = list(map(int, input().split(' '))) def all_same(arr): return all([x == arr[0] for x in arr])
    if all_same(elems):
        print(0)
        return
    if k == 1:
        print(-1)
        return
    if not all_same(elems[k - 1:]):
        print(-1)
        return
    target = elems[-1]
    to_delete = elems[0: k - 1]
    while to_delete and to_delete[-1] == target:
        to_delete.pop()
    print(len(to_delete)) So in C, we need to read n and k from input, then read the elements array.

def main():
    n, k = list(map(int, input().split(' ')))
    elems = list(map(int, input().split(' ')))
    def all_same(arr): return all([x == arr[0] for x in arr])
    if all_same(elems):
        print(0)
        return
    if k == 1:
        print(-1)
        return
    if not all_same(elems[k - 1:]):
        print(-1)
        return
    target = elems[-1]
    to_delete = elems[0: k - 1]
    while to_delete and to_delete[-1] == target:
        to_delete.pop()
    print(len(to_delete))

Else, target is last element. to_delete is first k-1 elements. Then, while the last element of to_delete is equal to target, pop it. The length of to_delete is the result.

int all_same(int arr[], int size) {

    if (size ==0) return 1;

    int first = arr[0];

    for (int i=1; i<size; i++) {

        if (arr[i] != first) return 0;

    }

    return 1;

}

Then, the first part's logic:

int main() {

    int n, k;

    scanf("%d %d", &n, &k);

    int elements[n];

    for (int i=0; i<n; i++) {

        scanf("%d", &elements[i]);

    }

    // Check all same

    if (all_same(elements, n)) {

        // first part's output is 0

        int first_result = 0;

        // proceed to second part

        char str[20]; // enough to hold integer

        sprintf(str, "%d", first_result);

        // process second part

        int num_g =0, num_p=0, score=0;

        for (int i=0; str[i] != '\0'; i++) {

            char c = str[i];

            if (c == 'g') {

                if (num_g - num_p >0) {

                    score +=1;

                    num_p +=1;

                } else {

                    num_g +=1;

                }

            } else if (c == 'p') {

                if (num_g - num_p >0) {

                    num_p +=1;

                } else {

                    score -=1;

                    num_g +=1;

                }

            }

        }

        printf("%d\n", score);

        return 0;

    }

    // else proceed

    if (k ==1) {

        int first_result = -1;

Now, the all_same function is needed. 

Putting all together:

#include <stdio.h>
#include <string.h>

int all_same(int arr[], int size) {
    if (size == 0) return 1;
    int first = arr[0];
    for (int i = 1; i < size; i++) {
        if (arr[i] != first) return 0;
    }
    return 1;
}

int main() {
    int n, k;
    scanf("%d %d", &n, &k);
    int elements[n];
    for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
        scanf("%d", &elements[i]);
    }

    int first_result;
    if (all_same(elements, n)) {
        first_result = 0;
    } else if (k == 1) {
        first_result = -1;
    } else {
        int start = k - 1;
        int sub_size = n - start;
        if (!all_same(elements + start, sub_size)) {
            first_result = -1;
        } else {
            int target = elements[n - 1];
            int to_delete_length = k - 1;
            while (to_delete_length > 0 && elements[to_delete_length - 1] == target) {
                to_delete_length--;
            }
            first_result = to_delete_length;
        }
    }

    char str[20];
    sprintf(str, "%d", first_result);

    int num_g = 0, num_p = 0, score = 0;
    for (int i = 0; str[i] != '\0'; i++) {
        char c = str[i];
        if (c == 'g') {
            if (num_g - num_p > 0) {
                score += 1;
                num_p += 1;
            } else {
                num_g += 1;
            }
        } else if (c == 'p') {
            if (num_g - num_p > 0) {
                num_p += 1;
            } else {
                score -= 1;
                num_g += 1;
            }
        }
    }

    printf("%d\n", score);

    return 0;
}
